DELETE /certificates/{certificate_id}.description: Revoke an existing Origin CA certificate by its serial number. You can use an Origin CA Key as your User Service Key or an API token when calling this endpoint ([see above](#requests)).

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

GET /certificates.description: List all existing Origin CA certificates for a given zone. You can use an Origin CA Key as your User Service Key or an API token when calling this endpoint ([see above](#requests)).

schema.description: Limit to the number of records returned.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service.

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results.

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results.

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters.

certificate.description: The Origin CA certificate. Will be newline-encoded.

csr.description: The Certificate Signing Request (CSR). Must be newline-encoded.

hostnames.description: Array of hostnames or wildcard names (e.g., *.example.com) bound to the certificate.

request_type.description: Signature type desired on certificate ("origin-rsa" (rsa), "origin-ecc" (ecdsa), or "keyless-certificate" (for Keyless SSL servers).

requested_validity.description: The number of days for which the certificate should be valid.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

requested_validity.description: The number of days for which the certificate should be valid.

GET /certificates/{certificate_id}.description: Get an existing Origin CA certificate by its serial number. You can use an Origin CA Key as your User Service Key or an API token when calling this endpoint ([see above](#requests)).

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

hostnames.description: Array of hostnames or wildcard names (e.g., *.example.com) bound to the certificate.

requested_validity.description: The number of days for which the certificate should be valid.

POST /certificates.description: Create an Origin CA certificate. You can use an Origin CA Key as your User Service Key or an API token when calling this endpoint ([see above](#requests)).

csr.description: The Certificate Signing Request (CSR). Must be newline-encoded.

hostnames.description: Array of hostnames or wildcard names (e.g., *.example.com) bound to the certificate.

request_type.description: Signature type desired on certificate ("origin-rsa" (rsa), "origin-ecc" (ecdsa), or "keyless-certificate" (for Keyless SSL servers).

requested_validity.description: The number of days for which the certificate should be valid.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.
